Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888, 0601.163. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 99) (Incorrectly labelled 1924,1201.741)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 723, no. 823)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1787) (phase 2)
